document.docAuthor: Markevičiūtė, Radvilė, Podenas, Sigitas, Saldaitis, Aidas & Bernotienė, Rasa
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Antocha Osten Sacken, 1860 (Diptera: Limoniidae) from Sichuan China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Antocha Osten Sacken, 1860 (Diptera: Limoniidae) from Sichuan China

paragraph.keyLead:
3 Legs yellow, only terminal tarsomeres more darkened......................................
A. picturata Alexander

4 Gonocoxite oval, apex narrowly elongate ( Figs 6, 7 ).......................................
A. fortidens Alexander

– Gonocoxite cone-shaped, apex not narrowly elongate ( Fig. 8 )..................
A. nebulipennis nebulipennis Alexander

5 Apex of outer gonostylus bidentate ( Fig. 10 ); vein m -cu longer than the distance between it and base of cell dm ( Fig. 2 ).......................................................................................
A. bidens Alexander

– Apex of outer gonostylus blunt; vein m -cu shorter than the distance between it and cell dm ( Fig. 11 )....................................................................................................
A. nigribasis Alexander

8 Paramere twisted into spiral, tip at approximately same level as apex of aedeagus ( Fig. 12 )............................................................................................
A. bella Markevičiūtė & Podenas
sp. nov.

– Paramere straight and longer than aedeagus ( Fig. 13 ).........................................
A. indica Brunetti
9 Body length less than 7.5 mm ; abdominal tergites dark brown or yellowish brown; abdominal sternites brown or yellow.. 10

– Body length exceeds 7.5 mm ; abdominal tergites dull black; abdominal sternites gray...........
A. flavidibasis Alexander
10 Caudal margin of tergite 9 with extra lobes, bumps or deep U-shaped median notch ( Figs 6, 8, 9 , 14, 15 ).............. 11

11 Caudal margin of tergite 9 of male genitalia with two widely separated tooth-like projections ( Fig. 14 ); outer gonostylus with cleft apex ( Fig. 14 )....................................................................
A. bifida Alexander

– Caudal margin of tergite 9 of male genitalia with two rounded projections or lobes ( Figs 9 , 15 ); outer gonostylus without cleft apex ( Figs 9 , 15 ).................................................................................... 12

12 Caudal margin of tergite 9 with two lateral lobes obliquely truncated, outer angles rounded ( Fig. 9 ); apex of outer gonostylus produced into a foot-shaped enlargement ( Fig. 9 )........................................
A. emarginata Alexander

– Caudal margin of tergite 9 of male genitalia with two rounded projections; outer gonostylus narrowed at apex and strongly curved ( Fig. 15 )......................................................
A. nebulipennis immaculata Alexander

– Lateral structure of aedeagus very slender, twisted into a complete spiral turn at distal end ( Fig. 16 )..
A. spiralis Alexander

15 Aedeagus with each lateral structure stout and powerful, at near midlength on mesal face bearing a stout curved spine ( Fig. 17 ).............................................................................
A. constricta Alexander

– Aedeagus with each lateral structure somewhat lyriform, narrowed to acute points, on margin at about one-third the length bearing a slender acute branch ( Fig. 18 )..............................................
A. multidentata Alexander

17 Aedeagus apex thickened and rounded ( Fig. 20 )........................................
A. lacteibasis Alexander

– Aedeagus apex narrow and curved ( Fig. 21 )...........................................
A. minuticornis Alexander
